page.title: 09BURRINGTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The land was given in{1856}by the Earl of Portsmouth, who owned nearly all the village.The cost of building was met by public subscription, a grant from the Church of England and by farmers who hauled the materials free of charge.Some of the stone came from the old church house.It was an all-age school for 130 scholars.The main room was divided in two by a screen,and the Infants room was the present office. We still have the teacher's{Victorian} {desk.In 1985 there are 33 children in school.The Infants are in an outside classroom.The main building has been extended to include a kitchen, but we have dinners brought from Chulmleigh School by car.We have our own swimming pool, and a big playing field.We can use the Parish Hall when we need extra space for country dancing or drama.
